intro: Spermacoce jaliscensis, commonly known as the Jalisco morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, spherical berries that contain the seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in disturbed areas and along roadsides. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
